courses.name: Introductory Meteorology
courses.description: (same as GEOG 1050). Physical processes of atmosphere in relation to day-to-day changes in weather.

courses.name: Introduction to Atmospheric Science
courses.description: Physical process of the atmospheric and climate system will be related to day-to-day weather changes. Students will be introduced to the laws of motion and thermodynamics that govern motions in geophysical fluid. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: MATH 1160 or concurrent enrollment in MATH 1500

courses.name: Natural Hazards
courses.description: A survey of natural hazards, including severe thunderstorms, tornadoes, flooding, tropical storms, ocean movements, earthquakes, tsunamis, volcanoes, asteroids, solar weather, managing risk and human impacts.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Weather Briefing
courses.description: Student participation in daily discussions of current weather patterns and forecasts and their applications to weather sensitive activities including aviation, agriculture and industry.

courses.name: Weather Communication
courses.description: Methods of surface and upper air weather observation.  How such data are distributed to users in the meteorological community is also addressed.

courses.name: Independent Study in Atmospheric Science
courses.description: Independent study of a topic dealing with meteorological theory or application of meteorological science to the solution of relevant problem.

courses.name: Climates of the World
courses.description: (same as GEOG 3600). A study of the world distribution of climates based on "cause and effect" relationships. Special attention is given to the impacts of climate on humanity.

courses.name: Topics in Atmospheric Science
courses.description: Development of theory and applications for selected topics in atmospheric science.

courses.name: Broadcast Meteorology I
courses.description: An introduction to broadcast meteorology including the business of media, use of meteorological data to produce a forecast, and television and radio presentation skills.  Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: ATM_SC 1110, ATM_SC 2720, or equivalentsCorequisites: ATM_SC 4710.  Restricted to Atmospheric Science majors or instructor's consent

courses.name: Atmospheric Thermodynamics
courses.description: (cross-leveled with ATM_SC 7310). Thermodynamics of dry and moist air, atmospheric hydrostatics, convection, and development of the fundamental equations of geophysical fluid dynamics.
courses.prerequisites: ATM_SC 1050, MATH 1700 (C or better), and one physics course

courses.name: Atmospheric Dynamics
courses.description: (cross-leveled with ATM_SC 7320). Dynamics and kinematics of atmospheric flow. Manipulation of fundamental equations, numerical modeling of atmosphere.

courses.name: Mesoscale Meteorology and Dynamics
courses.description: (cross-leveled with ATM_SC 7350). Survey of mesoscale phenomena, observing systems, analysis techniques, and modeling. Topics include fronts, jet streaks, gravity waves, organized convection, tornadoes, and severe local storm forecasting and structure.

courses.name: Micrometeorology
courses.description: (cross-leveled with ATM_SC 7400). Study of transport processes in the surface boundary layer. Important applications in pollution will be discussed.

courses.name: Advanced Meteorological Observation and Instrumentation
courses.description: Automated weather observation and instrumentation used in networks of remote automated weather stations. Emphasis on electronic instrumentation, datalogger programming, data collection and data management, generating dynamic reports on the World Wide Web. May be repeated for credit.

courses.name: Remote Sensing for Meteorology and Natural Resources
courses.description: (cross-leveled with ATM_SC 7510). Principles of remote sensing with emphasis on the properties of atmosphere and the earth's surface from airborne and satellite sensors. The techniques for using geosynchronous and orbiting satellite platforms for assessing weather and natural resource features.
courses.prerequisites: ATM_SC 1110, MATH 1500, junior standing or instructor's consent

courses.name: Environmental Biophysics
courses.description: (same as GEOG 4520; cross-leveled with ATM_SC 7520, GEOG 7520). Students will learn techniques and principles used to describe the microenvironment of living organisms and use quantitative expressions to estimate missing values, and mass transfer laws to estimate flux of energy, water and gas.

courses.name: Atmospheric Physics
courses.description: (cross-leveled with ATM_SC 7550). Physics of atmospheric nucleation-condensation, cloud droplet and precipitation formation, associated electrical phenomena, radiation transfer and remote sensing.   Recommended:  1 year of college Physics

courses.name: Radar Meteorology
courses.description: (cross-leveled with ATM_SC 7590). Course concerns the theory and application of radar in meteorology.   May be repeated for credit.

courses.name: Long-Range Forecasting
courses.description: (cross-leveled with ATM_SC 7650). Physical-dynamical principles of long-range forecasting from a month to a year. Empirical and numerical approaches in forecast practice.

courses.name: Synoptic Meteorology I
courses.description: (cross-leveled with ATM_SC 7710). Meteorological Data. Basic techniques for surface and upper air analysis, using selected examples of weather patterns.

courses.name: Synoptic Meteorology II
courses.description: (cross-leveled with ATM_SC 7720). Graphical analysis and interpretation of physical, kinematical and dynamical properties of the atmosphere. Analysis techniques applicable to atmospheric research.

courses.name: Synoptic Meteorology II - Writing Intensive
courses.description: (cross-leveled with ATM_SC 7720). Graphical analysis and interpretation of physical, kinematical and dynamical properties of the atmosphere. Analysis techniques applicable to atmospheric research.

courses.name: Advanced Forecasting Laboratory
courses.description: Advanced principles of weather forecasting will be addressed via online electronic modules and weekly laboratory exercises.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Numerical Methods in Atmospheric Science and Natural Resources
courses.description: (cross-leveled with ATM_SC 7800). Examines numerical methods used in solving differential equations, filtering data sets, and Fourier decomposition of discrete data sets.

courses.name: Internship in Meteorology
courses.description: Practical professional work experience with professional or scientific meteorologists in off-campus work environment. Graded on S/U basis only.

courses.name: Undergraduate Research in Atmospheric Science
courses.description: Research apprenticeship with a faculty mentor. Students are expected to develop initial concept for the research, design experiments, collect data, and analyze data with faculty input, oversight, and guidance.

courses.name: Daily Analysis and Forecast Interpretation
courses.description: A Capstone experience. In depth daily analysis and interpretation by students of the current and forecast states of the atmosphere. Discussions of implications to specific weather sensitive activities.
courses.prerequisites: senior standing and Atmospheric Science major

courses.name: Topics in Atmospheric Science
courses.description: Development of theory and applications for selected topics in atmospheric science.

courses.description: (cross-leveled with ATM_SC 4400). Study of transport processes in the surface boundary layer. Important applications in pollution will be discussed.

Graduate student credit is dependent upon completion of additional advanced research assignments.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.description: (cross-leveled with ATM_SC 4550). Physics of atmospheric nucleation-condensation, cloud droplet and precipitation formation, associated electrical phenomena, radiation transfer and remote sensing.
courses.prerequisites: 1 year of college Physics and MATH 1700

courses.name: Radar Meteorology
courses.description: (cross-leveled with ATM_SC 4590). Course concerns the theory and application of radar in meteorology.  Graduate students will be required to conduct an independent research project using radar, in addition to the undergraduate requirements for the class. May be repeated for credit.

courses.name: Synoptic Meteorology II
courses.description: (cross-leveled with ATM_SC 4720). Graphical analysis and interpretation of physical, kinematical and dynamical properties of the atmosphere. Analysis techniques applicable to atmospheric research.

courses.name: Numerical Methods in Atmospheric Science and Natural Resources
courses.description: (cross-leveled with ATM_SC 4800). Examines numerical methods used in solving differential equations, filtering data sets, and Fourier decomposition of discrete data sets.

courses.name: Topics in Atmospheric Science
courses.description: Development of the theory with its application for selected topics in atmospheric science.

courses.name: Problems in Atmospheric Science
courses.description: Independent study by graduate students in atmospheric science.

courses.name: Masters Research in Atmospheric Science
courses.description: Original investigation in atmospheric science in support of a master's thesis.  Graded on S/U basis only.

courses.name: Atmospheric General Circulation
courses.description: Comprehensive review of dynamical theories of general circulation with intensive discussion of current problems.

courses.name: Tropical Meteorology
courses.description: Study of the synoptic and dynamic character of the atmosphere in the tropical regions, including an examination of the general circulation and tropical storms.
courses.prerequisites: ATM_SC 4710 or ATM_SC 7710, ATM_SC 4720 or ATM_SC 7720 and MATH 2300; instructor's consent.  Graded on A-F basis only

courses.name: Radiation in the Atmosphere
courses.description: Physics of solar and infrared radiative transfer in the atmosphere, including energy conversion effects, atmospheric optics, and photochemical processes.
courses.prerequisites: one year College Physics and MATH 1700

courses.name: Nowcasting
courses.description: Students will learn the science of nowcasting through the study of the various methods used and apply their knowledge in the design of the elements of a nowcast system and practical nowcasting exercises.

courses.name: Advanced Climate Dynamics
courses.description: Study of global climate; application of large scale atmospheric dynamics; conservation of various forms of energy, climatic evaluation, large scale climatic modification.
courses.prerequisites: ATM_SC 4320 or ATM_SC 7320 and ATM_SC 8400 or ATM_SC 3600

courses.name: Topics in Atmospheric Science
courses.description: Development of the theory with its application for selected topics in atmospheric science.

courses.name: Problems in Atmospheric Science
courses.description: Independent study by graduate students in atmospheric science.

courses.name: Seminar in Atmospheric Science
courses.description: Seminar in Atmospheric Science.

courses.name: Doctoral Research in Atmospheric Science
courses.description: Original investigation in atmospheric science in support of a doctoral dissertation.  Graded on S/U basis only.

courses.name: Introduction to Chaos Theory
courses.description: Atmospheric predictability and related topics are examined as they relate to governing equations of motion and their non-linear solutions.

courses.name: Advanced Dynamic Meteorology
courses.description: Application of perturbation dynamics, advanced dynamics, and numerical methods to study of atmospheric circulations.

courses.name: Advanced Applications of Weather Radar
courses.description: This course will investigate quantitative uses of weather radar data that go beyond standard reflectivity and velocity image interpretation, particularly those that use new techniques such as dual-polarization. Students will develop methods to analyze and display meteorological radar data. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.recommendation: MATH 1700, PHYSCS 2760, INFOTC 1040 or equivalent, ATM_SC 4590

courses.name: Advanced Synoptic Meteorology
courses.description: Detailed examination of vertical motions, their forcing, and how each is diagnosed (quasigeostrophic theory, the Trenberth approximation, Q-vectors). Current issues in synoptic meteorology and operational forecasting are discussed.

courses.name: Convection and Lightning
courses.description: Cumulus convection and cloud physics topics that will facilitate a deeper understanding of cloud electrification and lightning production are studied.  Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: ATM_SC 4710 or ATM_SC 7710, ATM_SC 4720 or ATM_SC 7720, MATH 2300; instructor's consent

courses.name: Numerical Weather Prediction
courses.description: Examination of finite difference and objective analysis techniques, basic physical concepts, and parameterization of physical processes.  Experience with a range of models (1-D cloud to operational PE models) stressed.
